title: The Best Early Black Friday Designer Deals You Can Shop on Amazon
description: Over $300 off a Jacquemus bag and free Prime shipping? Yes, please.
excerpt: Over $300 off a Jacquemus bag and free Prime shipping? Yes, please.
text: Claudio Lavenia//Getty ImagesWhile many of us use Amazon to restock our favorite drugstore skincare and try out viral TikTok products, the e-retailer actually has a selection of designer items from its Luxury Stores and The Shop by Shopbop, and you can score them at a massive discount ahead of Black Friday. Currently, tons of designer clothes, shoes, and accessories are up to 72 percent off. That means you can save big on everything from a coveted Jacquemus Chiquito bag and Vince sweater dress to some Stuart Weitzman loafers, just in time for gift-giving season.Tory Burch Robinson Spazzolato Convertible Crescent Bag Now 30% OffCoach Abigail Ballet FlatsNow 40% OffVince Wool-Cashmere V Sweater DressNow 72% OffMarc Jacobs The Leather Mini Duffle BagNow 30% OffTory Burch McGraw Leather ToteNow 30% OffTheory Crepe Strapless Dress Now 33% OffCoach Tabby Shoulder Bag 26Now 29% OffÉliou Yara Freshwater Pearl EarringsNow 40% OffVince High-Waisted Wide-Leg PantsNow 60% OffJacquemus Le Grand Chiquito BagNow 30% OffUlla Johnson Vine Chain NecklaceNow 30% OffStuart Weitzman Blake Penny LoaferNow 54% OffAnine Bing Jaci Daydreams SweatshirtNow 30% Off8 Other Reasons Crescent Bag Now 30% OffTheory Crop Trench Now 45% OffWhite + Warren Cashmere Travel Wrap Scarf Now 40% OffVeronica Beard Mason Baseball TeeNow 30% OffAnnika Inez Heart HoopsNow 20% OffWhile you can shop for new items, Amazon also has a great assortment of pre-loved vintage designer goods. Last Black Friday, What Goes Around Comes Around, a luxury vintage store that sells on Amazon, offered up to 15 percent off on Carrie Bradshaw-approved Fendi Baguettes, Chanel flap purses, and even a rare Hermès Kelly. The store has yet to reveal the details of its Amazon Black Friday 2024 sale, but we expect early deals to drop any day now. In the meantime, we recommend doing a little prep work and creating your wishlist in advance. Because these items are vintage, stock is limited, so you’ll need to shop with lightning speed to score your desired piece. And if you’re truly set on securing something (perhaps a diamond-encrusted Rolex watch), you may want to consider paying sticker price. Seeking some inspiration? We pulled a few standout luxury pieces worth bookmarking ASAP.Fendi Pre-Loved Grey Leather BaguetteRolex Pre-Loved 18K Gold & Ruby Pave Diamond Datejust 69128Dior Pre-Loved Black Cannage Leather Lady Dior BagGucci Pre-Loved Leather GG Marmont Belt 85 Goyard Pre-Loved Blue Goyardine Canvas Saint-Louis GMSaint Laurent Pre-Loved Cream Grainy Leather Round Camera BagSarah Maberry is a fashion and luxury commerce editor at Hearst Magazines, where she covers fashion, beauty and pop culture. A seasoned trend forecaster and fashion historian, she analyzes viral products and trends on a deeper level, helping readers determine what's worth buying. When she’s not writing for ELLE, Harper’s BAZAAR, Town & Country, Esquire, Cosmopolitan and other publications, she can be found roaming the Museum at FIT (her alma matter) or sewing her own couture while she binge-watches reality TV.
html:
While many of us use Amazon to restock our favorite drugstore skincare and try out viral TikTok products, the e-retailer actually has a selection of designer items from its Luxury Stores and The Shop by Shopbop, and you can score them at a massive discount ahead of Black Friday. Currently, tons of designer clothes, shoes, and accessories are up to 72 percent off. That means you can save big on everything from a coveted Jacquemus Chiquito bag and Vince sweater dress to some Stuart Weitzman loafers, just in time for gift-giving season.

Tory Burch Robinson Spazzolato Convertible Crescent Bag

Now 30% Off

Coach Abigail Ballet Flats

Now 40% Off

Vince Wool-Cashmere V Sweater Dress

Now 72% Off

Marc Jacobs The Leather Mini Duffle Bag

Now 30% Off

Tory Burch McGraw Leather Tote

Now 30% Off

Theory Crepe Strapless Dress

Now 33% Off

Coach Tabby Shoulder Bag 26

Now 29% Off

Now 40% Off

Vince High-Waisted Wide-Leg Pants

Now 60% Off

Jacquemus Le Grand Chiquito Bag

Now 30% Off

Ulla Johnson Vine Chain Necklace

Now 30% Off

Stuart Weitzman Blake Penny Loafer

Now 54% Off

Anine Bing Jaci Daydreams Sweatshirt

Now 30% Off

8 Other Reasons Crescent Bag

Now 30% Off

Theory Crop Trench

Now 45% Off

White + Warren Cashmere Travel Wrap Scarf

Now 40% Off

Veronica Beard Mason Baseball Tee

Now 30% Off

Annika Inez Heart Hoops

Now 20% Off

While you can shop for new items, Amazon also has a great assortment of pre-loved vintage designer goods. Last Black Friday, What Goes Around Comes Around, a luxury vintage store that sells on Amazon, offered up to 15 percent off on Carrie Bradshaw-approved Fendi Baguettes, Chanel flap purses, and even a rare Hermès Kelly. The store has yet to reveal the details of its Amazon Black Friday 2024 sale, but we expect early deals to drop any day now.

In the meantime, we recommend doing a little prep work and creating your wishlist in advance. Because these items are vintage, stock is limited, so you’ll need to shop with lightning speed to score your desired piece. And if you’re truly set on securing something (perhaps a diamond-encrusted Rolex watch), you may want to consider paying sticker price. Seeking some inspiration? We pulled a few standout luxury pieces worth bookmarking ASAP.

Fendi Pre-Loved Grey Leather Baguette

Rolex Pre-Loved 18K Gold & Ruby Pave Diamond Datejust 69128

Dior Pre-Loved Black Cannage Leather Lady Dior Bag

Gucci Pre-Loved Leather GG Marmont Belt 85

Goyard Pre-Loved Blue Goyardine Canvas Saint-Louis GM

Saint Laurent Pre-Loved Cream Grainy Leather Round Camera Bag

Sarah Maberry is a fashion and luxury commerce editor at Hearst Magazines, where she covers fashion, beauty and pop culture. A seasoned trend forecaster and fashion historian, she analyzes viral products and trends on a deeper level, helping readers determine what's worth buying. When she’s not writing for ELLE, Harper’s BAZAAR, Town & Country, Esquire, Cosmopolitan and other publications, she can be found roaming the Museum at FIT (her alma matter) or sewing her own couture while she binge-watches reality TV.
